info.title: Xwebhook API
info.description:
Welcome to the Xwebhook API documentation!

Useful links: [Homepage](https://www.xwebhook.com) | [Support email](mailto:support+docs@xwebhook.com) | [Blog](https://www.xwebhook.com/blog/) | [Slack Community](https://www.xwebhook.com/slack/)

# Introduction

This is the reference documentation and schemas for the [Xwebhook webhook service](https://www.xwebhook.com) API. For tutorials and other documentation please refer to [the documentation](https://docs.xwebhook.com).

## Main concepts

In Xwebhook you have four important entities you will be interacting with:

- `messages`: these are the webhooks being sent. They can have contents and a few other properties.
- `application`: this is where `messages` are sent to. Usually you want to create one application for each user on your platform.
- `endpoint`: endpoints are the URLs messages will be sent to. Each application can have multiple `endpoints` and each message sent to that application will be sent to all of them (unless they are not subscribed to the sent event type).
- `event-type`: event types are identifiers denoting the type of the message being sent. Event types are primarily used to decide which events are sent to which endpoint.


## Authentication

Get your authentication token (`AUTH_TOKEN`) from the [Xwebhook dashboard](https://dashboard.xwebhook.com) and use it as part of the `Authorization` header as such: `Authorization: Bearer ${AUTH_TOKEN}`.

<SecurityDefinitions />


## Code samples

The code samples assume you already have the respective libraries installed and you know how to use them. For the latest information on how to do that, please refer to [the documentation](https://docs.xwebhook.com/).


## Idempotency

Xwebhook supports [idempotency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idempotence) for safely retrying requests without accidentally performing the same operation twice. This is useful when an API call is disrupted in transit and you do not receive a response.

To perform an idempotent request, pass the idempotency key in the `Idempotency-Key` header to the request. The idempotency key should be a unique value generated by the client. You can create the key in however way you like, though we suggest using UUID v4, or any other string with enough entropy to avoid collisions.

Xwebhook's idempotency works by saving the resulting status code and body of the first request made for any given idempotency key for any successful request. Subsequent requests with the same key return the same result.

Please note that idempotency is only supported for `POST` requests.


## Cross-Origin Resource Sharing

This API features Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) implemented in compliance with [W3C spec](https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/). And that allows cross-domain communication from the browser. All responses have a wildcard same-origin which makes them completely public and accessible to everyone, including any code on any site.

get.description: Verify the API server is up and running.
List of all the organization's applications.

parameters.description: Get an existing application, or create a new one if doesn't exist. It's two separate functions in the libs.

schema.title: Get If Exists
schema.description: Get an existing application, or create a new one if doesn't exist. It's two separate functions in the libs.

parameters.name: get_if_exists

x-codeSamples.label: JavaScript
TypeScript
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
application_out = xwebhook.application.create(ApplicationIn(
    uid="unique-app-identifier",
    name="My first application",
    rate_limit=1000
))
# Or 
application_out = xwebhook.application.get_or_create(ApplicationIn(
    uid="unique-app-identifier",
    name="My first application",
    rate_limit=1000
))

x-codeSamples.label: Python (Async)
x-codeSamples.source:
application_out = await xwebhook.application.create(ApplicationIn(
    uid="unique-app-identifier",
    name="My first application",
    rate_limit=1000
))
# Or 
application_out = await xwebhook.application.get_or_create(ApplicationIn(
    uid="unique-app-identifier",
    name="My first application",
    rate_limit=1000
))

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Kotlin
x-codeSamples.source:
val applicationOut = xwebhook.application.create(ApplicationIn()
    .uid("unique-app-identifier"),
    .name("My first application"),
    .rateLimit(1000)
)
// Or 
val applicationOut = xwebhook.application.getOrCreate(ApplicationIn()
    .uid("unique-app-identifier"),
    .name("My first application"),
    .rateLimit(1000)
)

x-codeSamples.label: Java
x-codeSamples.source:
ApplicationOut applicationOut = xwebhook.getApplication().create(new ApplicationIn()
    .uid("unique-app-identifier"),
    .name("My first application"),
    .rateLimit(1000)
)
// Or 
ApplicationOut applicationOut = xwebhook.getApplication().getOrCreate(new ApplicationIn()
    .uid("unique-app-identifier"),
    .name("My first application"),
    .rateLimit(1000)
)

x-codeSamples.label: Ruby
Rust
C#
cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://api.xwebhook.com/api/v1/app/' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "uid": "unique-app-identifier",
    "name": "My first application",
    "rateLimit": 1000
}'

get.description: Get an application.

x-codeSamples.label: JavaScript
TypeScript
Python
x-codeSamples.source:

    uid="unique-app-identifier",
    name="My first application",
    rate_limit=1000
))

x-codeSamples.label: Python (Async)
x-codeSamples.source:
application_out = await xwebhook.application.update('app_id', ApplicationIn(
    uid="unique-app-identifier",
    name="My first application",
    rate_limit=1000
))

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Kotlin
x-codeSamples.source:
val applicationOut = xwebhook.application.update('app_id', ApplicationIn()
    .uid("unique-app-identifier"),

x-codeSamples.label: Java
x-codeSamples.source:

x-codeSamples.label: Rust
C#
cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X 'PUT' \
  'https://api.xwebhook.com/api/v1/app/{app_id}/' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "uid": "unique-app-identifier",
    "name": "My first application",
    "rateLimit": 1000
}'

post.description: Use this function to get magic links (and authentication codes) for connecting your users to the Application Portal.

Logout an app token.

Trying to log out other tokens will fail.

get.description: Return the list of event types.

post.description:
Create new or unarchive existing event type.

Unarchiving an event type will allow endpoints to filter on it and messages to be sent with it.
Endpoints filtering on the event type before archival will continue to filter on it.
This operation does not preserve the description and schemas.

x-codeSamples.label: JavaScript
TypeScript
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
event_type_out = xwebhook.event_type.create(EventTypeIn(
    description="A user has signed up",
    schemas={'1': {'title': 'Invoice Paid Event', 'description': 'An invoice was paid by a user', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'invoiceId': {'description': 'The invoice id', 'type': 'string'}, 'userId': {'description': 'The user id', 'type': 'string'}}, 'required': ['invoiceId', 'userId']}},
    archived=False,
    name="user.signup"
))

x-codeSamples.label: Python (Async)
x-codeSamples.source:
event_type_out = await xwebhook.event_type.create(EventTypeIn(
    description="A user has signed up",
    schemas={'1': {'title': 'Invoice Paid Event', 'description': 'An invoice was paid by a user', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'invoiceId': {'description': 'The invoice id', 'type': 'string'}, 'userId': {'description': 'The user id', 'type': 'string'}}, 'required': ['invoiceId', 'userId']}},
    archived=False,
    name="user.signup"
))

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Kotlin
Java
x-codeSamples.source:
EventTypeOut eventTypeOut = xwebhook.getEventType().create(new EventTypeIn()
    .description("A user has signed up"),
    .schemas("{" +
        "\"1\": {" +
                "\"title\": \"Invoice Paid Event\"," +
                "\"description\": \"An invoice was paid by a user\"," +
                "\"type\": \"object\"," +
                "\"properties\": {" +
                        "\"invoiceId\": {" +
                                "\"description\": \"The invoice id\"," +
                                "\"type\": \"string\"" +
                        "}," +
                        "\"userId\": {" +
                                "\"description\": \"The user id\"," +
                                "\"type\": \"string\"" +
                        "}" +
                "}," +
                "\"required\": [" +
                        "\"invoiceId\"," +
                        "\"userId\"" +
                "]" +
        "}" +
    "}"),
    .archived(False),
    .name("user.signup")
)

x-codeSamples.label: Ruby
Rust
C#
CLI
cURL

delete.description:
Archive an event type.

Endpoints already configured to filter on an event type will continue to do so after archival.
However, new messages can not be sent with it and endpoints can not filter on it.
An event type can be unarchived with the
[create operation](#operation/create_event_type_api_v1_event_type__post).

get.description: List the application's endpoints.

post.description:
Create a new endpoint for the application.

When `secret` is `null` the secret is automatically generated (recommended)

x-codeSamples.label: JavaScript
x-codeSamples.source:
const endpointOut = await xwebhook.endpoint.create('app_id', {
    uid: "unique-endpoint-identifier",
    url: "https://example.com/webhook/",
    version: 1,
    description: "An example endpoint name",
    filterTypes: [
        "user.signup",
        "user.deleted"
    ],
    channels: [
        "project_123",
        "group_2"
    ],
    disabled: false,
    rateLimit: 1000,
    secret: "whsec_C2FVsBQIhrscChlQIMV+b5sSYspob7oD"
});

x-codeSamples.label: TypeScript
x-codeSamples.source:
const endpointOut = await xwebhook.endpoint.create('app_id', {
    uid: "unique-endpoint-identifier",
    url: "https://example.com/webhook/",
    version: 1,
    description: "An example endpoint name",
    filterTypes: [
        "user.signup",
        "user.deleted"
    ],
    channels: [
        "project_123",
        "group_2"
    ],
    disabled: false,
    rateLimit: 1000,
    secret: "whsec_C2FVsBQIhrscChlQIMV+b5sSYspob7oD"
});

x-codeSamples.label: Python
x-codeSamples.source:
endpoint_out = xwebhook.endpoint.create('app_id', EndpointIn(
    uid="unique-endpoint-identifier",
    url="https://example.com/webhook/",
    version=1,
    description="An example endpoint name",
    filter_types=['user.signup', 'user.deleted'],
    channels=['project_123', 'group_2'],
    disabled=False,
    rate_limit=1000,
    secret="whsec_C2FVsBQIhrscChlQIMV+b5sSYspob7oD"
))

x-codeSamples.label: Python (Async)
x-codeSamples.source:
endpoint_out = await xwebhook.endpoint.create('app_id', EndpointIn(
    uid="unique-endpoint-identifier",
    url="https://example.com/webhook/",
    version=1,
    description="An example endpoint name",
    filter_types=['user.signup', 'user.deleted'],
    channels=['project_123', 'group_2'],
    disabled=False,
    rate_limit=1000,
    secret="whsec_C2FVsBQIhrscChlQIMV+b5sSYspob7oD"
))

x-codeSamples.label: Go
x-codeSamples.source:
endpointOut, err := xwebhookClient.Endpoint.Create("app_id", &xwebhook.EndpointIn{
    Uid: "unique-endpoint-identifier",
    Url: "https://example.com/webhook/",
    Version: 1,
    Description: "An example endpoint name",
    FilterTypes: [...]string{"user.signup", "user.deleted"},
    Channels: [...]string{"project_123", "group_2"},
    Disabled: False,
    RateLimit: 1000,
    Secret: "whsec_C2FVsBQIhrscChlQIMV+b5sSYspob7oD"
})

x-codeSamples.label: Kotlin
x-codeSamples.source:
val endpointOut = xwebhook.endpoint.create('app_id', EndpointIn()
    .uid("unique-endpoint-identifier"),
    .url("https://example.com/webhook/"),
    .version(1),
    .description("An example endpoint name"),
    .filterTypes(arrayOf("user.signup", "user.deleted")),
    .channels(arrayOf("project_123", "group_2")),
    .disabled(False),
    .rateLimit(1000),
    .secret("whsec_C2FVsBQIhrscChlQIMV+b5sSYspob7oD")
)

x-codeSamples.label: Java
x-codeSamples.source:
EndpointOut endpointOut = xwebhook.getEndpoint().create('app_id', new EndpointIn()
    .uid("unique-endpoint-identifier"),
    .url("https://example.com/webhook/"),
    .version(1),
    .description("An example endpoint name"),
    .filterTypes(new String[]{"user.signup", "user.deleted"}),
    .channels(new String[]{"project_123", "group_2"}),
    .disabled(False),
    .rateLimit(1000),
    .secret("whsec_C2FVsBQIhrscChlQIMV+b5sSYspob7oD")
)

x-codeSamples.label: Ruby
x-codeSamples.source:
endpoint_out = xwebhook.endpoint.create('app_id', Xwebhook::EndpointIn.new({
    "uid": "unique-endpoint-identifier",
    "url": "https://example.com/webhook/",
    "version": 1,
    "description": "An example endpoint name",
    "filter_types": [
        "user.signup",
        "user.deleted"
    ],
    "channels": [
        "project_123",
        "group_2"
    ],
    "disabled": false,
    "rate_limit": 1000,
    "secret": "whsec_C2FVsBQIhrscChlQIMV+b5sSYspob7oD"
}))

x-codeSamples.label: Rust
x-codeSamples.source:
let endpoint_out = xwebhook.endpoint().create("app_id", EndpointIn {
    uid: "unique-endpoint-identifier".to_string(),
    url: "https://example.com/webhook/".to_string(),
    version: 1,
    description: "An example endpoint name".to_string(),
    filter_types: vec!["user.signup".to_string(), "user.deleted".to_string()],
    channels: vec!["project_123".to_string(), "group_2".to_string()],
    disabled: False,
    rate_limit: 1000,
    secret: "whsec_C2FVsBQIhrscChlQIMV+b5sSYspob7oD".to_string()
}).await?;

x-codeSamples.label: C#
x-codeSamples.source:
var endpointOut = await xwebhook.Endpoint.CreateAsync("app_id", new EndpointIn{
    uid: "unique-endpoint-identifier",
    url: "https://example.com/webhook/",
    version: 1,
    description: "An example endpoint name",
    filterTypes: new string[] {"user.signup", "user.deleted"},
    channels: new string[] {"project_123", "group_2"},
    disabled: false,
    rateLimit: 1000,
    secret: "whsec_C2FVsBQIhrscChlQIMV+b5sSYspob7oD"
})

x-codeSamples.label: CLI
x-codeSamples.source:
xwebhook endpoint create 'app_id' '{
    "uid": "unique-endpoint-identifier",
    "url": "https://example.com/webhook/",
    "version": 1,
    "description": "An example endpoint name",
    "filterTypes": [
        "user.signup",
        "user.deleted"
    ],
    "channels": [
        "project_123",
        "group_2"
    ],
    "disabled": false,
    "rateLimit": 1000,
    "secret": "whsec_C2FVsBQIhrscChlQIMV+b5sSYspob7oD"
}'

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://api.xwebhook.com/api/v1/app/{app_id}/endpoint/' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "uid": "unique-endpoint-identifier",
    "url": "https://example.com/webhook/",
    "version": 1,
    "description": "An example endpoint name",
    "filterTypes": [
        "user.signup",
        "user.deleted"
    ],
    "channels": [
        "project_123",
        "group_2"
    ],
    "disabled": false,
    "rateLimit": 1000,
    "secret": "whsec_C2FVsBQIhrscChlQIMV+b5sSYspob7oD"
}'

get.description:
Get the endpoint's signing secret.

This is used to verify the authenticity of the webhook.
For more information please refer to [the consuming webhooks docs](https://docs.xwebhook.com/consuming-webhooks/).

post.description: Rotates the endpoint's signing secret.  The previous secret will be valid for the next 24 hours.
Resend all failed messages since a given time.

x-codeSamples.label: JavaScript
TypeScript
Python (Async)
C#

get.description: Get the additional headers to be sent with the webhook

put.description: Set the additional headers to be sent with the webhook

patch.description: Partially set the additional headers to be sent with the webhook

get.description:
List all of the application's messages.

The `before` parameter lets you filter all items created before a certain date and is ignored if an iterator is passed.
The `after` parameter lets you filter all items created after a certain date and is ignored if an iterator is passed.
`before` and `after` cannot be used simultaneously.

post.description:
Creates a new message and dispatches it to all of the application's endpoints.

The `eventId` is an optional custom unique ID. It's verified to be unique only up to a day, after that no verification will be made.
If a message with the same `eventId` already exists for any application in your environment, a 409 conflict error will be returned.

The `eventType` indicates the type and schema of the event. All messages of a certain `eventType` are expected to have the same schema. Endpoints can choose to only listen to specific event types.
Messages can also have `channels`, which similar to event types let endpoints filter by them. Unlike event types, messages can have multiple channels, and channels don't imply a specific message content or schema.

The `payload' property is the webhook's body (the actual webhook message).

x-codeSamples.label: JavaScript
TypeScript
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
message_out = xwebhook.message.create('app_id', MessageIn(
    event_type="user.signup",
    event_id="evt_pNZKtWg8Azow",
    channels=['project_123', 'group_2'],
    payload={'username': 'test_user', 'email': 'test@example.com'},
    payload_retention_period=90
))

x-codeSamples.label: Python (Async)
x-codeSamples.source:
message_out = await xwebhook.message.create('app_id', MessageIn(
    event_type="user.signup",
    event_id="evt_pNZKtWg8Azow",
    channels=['project_123', 'group_2'],
    payload={'username': 'test_user', 'email': 'test@example.com'},
    payload_retention_period=90
))

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Java
x-codeSamples.source:
MessageOut messageOut = xwebhook.getMessage().create('app_id', new MessageIn()
    .eventType("user.signup"),
    .eventId("evt_pNZKtWg8Azow"),
    .channels(new String[]{"project_123", "group_2"}),
    .payload("{" +
        "\"username\": \"test_user\"," +
        "\"email\": \"test@example.com\"" +
    "}"),
    .payloadRetentionPeriod(90)
)

get.description: Get a message by its ID or eventID.

List messages for a particular endpoint. Additionally includes metadata about the latest message attempt.

The `before` parameter lets you filter all items created before a certain date and is ignored if an iterator is passed.
List attempts by endpoint id
List attempts by message id
`msg_id`: Use a message id or a message `eventId`

post.description: Resend a message to the specified endpoint.

get.description:
DEPRECATED: please use list_attempts with endpoint_id as a query parameter instead.

List the message attempts for a particular endpoint.

Returning the endpoint.

The `before` parameter lets you filter all items created before a certain date and is ignored if an iterator is passed.

Deprecated: Please use "List Attempts by Endpoint" and "List Attempts by Msg" instead.

`msg_id`: Use a message id or a message `eventId`
`msg_id`: Use a message id or a message `eventId`
List the application's integrations.

TypeScript
Python (Async)
Rust
C#
cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://api.xwebhook.com/api/v1/app/{app_id}/integration/' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "name": "Example Integration"
}'

MessageAttemptFailingEvent.title: MessageAttemptFailingEvent
MessageAttemptFailingEvent.description:
Sent after a message has been failing for a few times.
It's sent on the fourth failure. It complements `message.attempt.exhausted` which is sent after the last failure.

- Manual = 1

The sending status of the message:
- Success = 0
- Pending = 1
- Fail = 2
- Sending = 3

StatusCodeClass.title: StatusCodeClass
StatusCodeClass.description:
The different classes of HTTP status codes:
- CodeNone = 0
- Code1xx = 100
- Code2xx = 200
- Code3xx = 300
- Code4xx = 400
- Code5xx = 500

WebhookTypes.title: WebhookTypes
WebhookTypes.description: All of the webhook types that we support

tags.name: Application
tags.description: Applications are where messages are sent to. In most cases you would wantto have one application for each of your users.

tags.name: Message
tags.description: Messages are the webhook events being sent.

tags.name: Endpoint
tags.description: Endpoints are the URLs messages will be sent to. Each application can have multiple endpoints and each message sent to that application will be sent to all of them (unless they are not subscribed to the sent event type).

tags.name: Integration
tags.description: Integrations are services your users connect an application to. An integration can manage the application and it's endpoints.

tags.name: Event Type
tags.description: Event types are identifiers denoting the type of message being sent. Event types are primarily used to decide which events are sent to which endpoint.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Easily give your users access to our pre-built management UI.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: The webhooks the Xwebhook service sends to notify you of events.

post.description: Sent when an endpoint has been automatically disabled after continuous failures.

Sent after a message has been failing for a few times.
